thread.title: Khalid Aucho rules out return to the Kenyan Premier league - Nairobi News
thread.title_full: Khalid Aucho rules out return to the Kenyan Premier league - Nairobi News

title: Khalid Aucho rules out return to the Kenyan Premier league - Nairobi News
text:
Khalid Aucho rules out return to the Kenyan Premier league Posted on Feb 14, 2017 4711 Views Ugandan midfielder Khalid Aucho when he spoke to Nairobi News at the Africa Cup of Nations in Gabon. PHOTO | DAVID KWALIMWA By DAVID KWALIMWA 
Midfield powerhouse Khalid Aucho has ruled out an immediate return to the SportPesa Premier League. 
The former Gor Mahia midfielder is currently a free agent after officially parting ways with South African club Baroka FC. 
Club owner Khurishi Mphaphlele has confirmed Aucho’s departure from the newly promoted club. 
The Ugandan player was released alongside compatriot Geoffrey Massa barely seven months into their respective two year contracts. 
Mphaphlele told Kick off : “We have parted ways with those two players and it was a mutual separation. They now have their clearances and are free.” 
Nairobi News had last month exclusively revealed that the player was unsettled at Baroka. 
At the time, during an interview with him at the African Cup of Nation in Gabon, the player also confirmed that he had lots of offers on the table. 
He said: “it looks like the coach doesn’t trust me, or maybe he wants to reward the players who helped him get promotion (to the top flight). I don’t want to sit on the bench.” 
He added: “See, I have several offers already and will be seeking to leave. Returning to Kenya? At the moment no, thanks. Zambia? Maybe, I need a fresh challenge.” 
The left footed midfielder is said to have also attracted interest from clubs in Vietnam, Israel and Zambia. Latest Stories
